name: places/ChIJqSah9r1ZwokRNq2QQu3lJWU
formattedAddress: 133 Pitt St, New York, NY 10002, USA
adrFormatAddress: 133 Pitt St, New York, NY 10002, USA

originalText.text: I’ve been living here for 8 and a half years. Rent is reasonable and because of that I was able to really grow in almost all aspects of my life. If you are not a person that is familiar with special populations you might have difficulty adjusting here. The residents here never gave me a hard time personally. Most just need a person to hear them out. The location is prime time. Food options are insane. Rooms are like dorm/barracks rooms only single occupancy units. It’s not a place to live permanently. It’s a place to get the rest of your life in check before you prepare yourself for a long term housing/renting/owning situation. Million Dollar view.

originalText.text: Terrible place to live even the projects would be better. If people want to live here then I honestly suggest sliding towanna cash. She takes bribes and is notorious for stealing.

originalText.text:
I’m not a resident of this building but my brother is. My brother has mobility issues due to an illness that has gotten worse over the past 2 months. According to what my brother said the staff arranged for a cleaning service to help him clean his unit and these people threw out all his clothes he was left with 1 pair of sweats, 1 shirt and some old stinky shoes and that is it. Due to his mobility issues he has not been able to shower and the HHA that is supposed to come 3 times a week comes when she wants. He has been completely neglected by these people and they don’t seem to care. I will be calling supervisors on Monday and giving them the opportunity to rectify the situation and if they don’t they will get sued for gross negligence. If I could give this place 0 stars I would

Edit: I spoke with the supervisor but they were never able to rectify the situation since my brother passed away from COVID

originalText.text:
I'm writing this review because we are currently desperate and do not know what to do...

My partner (who won't be named for legal reasons) is a tenet currently living at The Lee. She moved in from a shelter through the Door and Breaking Ground programs. She moved in at age 23. The program was supposed to be temporary housing to help transition her to her own apartment. She resides in a SRO, and was told that she would be moved out before age 25. She adhered to every program and and followed all directions, yet she is 31 and still living there.

To make things more complicated, we just recently had a child. I have been staying with her since she was pregnant, with hopes we would be finally moving out. We alerted the staff when she was two months pregnant, so the staff had ample time to help us but they haven't. The staff claimed it was because of back rent that we couldnt move forward but even after I personally paid off my partner's arrears, we are still given excuse after excuse. Our child is now five months old and we are still in this tiny box. We are awoken every week to screaming, and people fighting in the hallways, last year someone fire a gun in the staircase, and just  this past week there was a stabbing in the lobby.

We do not feel safe here. My partner does not want to be here. We don't want trouble for abandoning the apartment, but the Lee is giving us very little choice. I fear for my partner and my child. Please do not move here, even if you are desperate.
